title: Parking Meters would like to have a Non-311 SR request tracking tool available to them. They would a...
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- davidr.smith@austintexas.gov -->

> What application are you using?

Other / Not sure

> Describe the problem.

Parking Meters would like to have a Non-311 SR request tracking tool available to them. They would also like to utilized the "My Assignments" tab to allow technicians to take photos of the SR being completed. Have already talked to Stephanie and Diana about this request.

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

We would like to see parking enforcement work orders for bike rack damage, graffiti on pay stations, scratched screens etc. show up on our knack page.

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

Currently emails are sent and we need a better way.

> Is there anything else we should know?

As soon as it can be worked out in order to improve business practices.

> Requested By
Davidr S.

title: New App: Parking Occupancy Data Management
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- joseph.al-hajeri@austintexas.gov -->

> Name

Joseph A.

> What application are you using?

Other / Not Sure

> Describe the problem.

Outdated and manual process for parking occupancy data collection. This causes extreme administrative waste, taking 3x the amount of time to complete a parking survey. Manual processes also present more opportunity for transpose errors. Data is being collected in the field and then transposed onto an excel spread sheet. 

> Describe the solution you have in mind.

The ability to have a custom back office to create data entry for parking surveys that a data collection team can enter into a digital tablet which is automatically linked to an analysis form that can generate automatic reports including spatial analysis and map view.

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

When we reduce the time it takes to complete a parking survey, which currently takes:
4 days to create map for surveys for data collection
6 days for actual data collection
7 days+ to input data into excel sheets for analysis
Total = 2 weeks 3-days, if not more since we have only one person that makes the maps and inputs data.

> Users

Parking Enterprise division staff, Ryan Royal, David Bracken and parking staff conducting data collection.

> Sponsorship

Jason R.and Jacob C.

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

System efficiency and congestion,Condition of transportation-related infrastructure

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

Affordability — Lower the cost of traveling in Austin by providing affordable travel options.,Sustainability — Promote integrated designs and quality additions to the built environment while reducing impacts and promoting efficient use of public resources.,Economic Prosperity — Promote economic growth for individuals and the city through strategic investments in transportation networks that meet the needs of the 21st century.,Innovation — Draw inspiration from forward-looking cities around the world, change the way we think about what’s possible, and set an example for the rest of the country.

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

An efficient process that will help ATD staff make better curb management decision in a more reasonable time frame with more accurate results. This coordinated process will give more accurate results both visual/spatial but technical. It will help standardize parking studies taken by ATD .

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

N/A

> Is there anything else we should know?

As soon as data and technology has time to help with this project, but respectfully, as soon as possible.

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

Typically through a custom built software program

[Attachment](https://api.knack.com/v1/applications/595d00ebd315cc4cb98daff4/download/asset/5e3479caaa654900155d742d/copyofgnaonstreetparkingoccupancy.xlsx) (88.63kb)

title: Project: [Your Project Name in Title Case]
body:
Describe the who, what, and why of this project in one or two sentences (No header).

## Background

Explain why the project matters, organizational context, customer insights including direct quotes from users.

## Scope & Deliverables

What are we delivering? What’s in scope, and what isn’t? Describe constraints you’re working with, e.g. “Can’t impact **\_**‘s workflow,” known roadblocks.

## Desired Outcomes

Impact this project can have, success metrics

## Timebox

How long should this take to build; optional section w/ caveats for more complex projects.

## Concepts and references

Helpful links; e.g. other solutions, screenshots of Slack convos, customer’s original request, anything too long for the one-pager that can exist as a separate doc. Folder in Drive where project assets are stored.

<!-- + Image  (No Header) (No Header) + -->
https://atd-dts.gitbook.io/wiki/product-ops/dts-website#images
The first image will be used as the project's thumbnail image on the website.

---
This Github issue represents a project of Austin Transportation's [Data & Technology Services](https://austinmobility.io/) team. Project status is documented regularly in the comments below.

- Add a new "Project:" label here: https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/labels. Use the hex code #3D3D3D. 
- Add a project evaluation here: https://atd.knack.com/dts#project-evaluation/
-->

title: Repair `atd_kits_sig_status_to_socrata`; notify appropriate parties of the unreachable MySQL server
body:
## TLDR
~KITS integration is down.~ We learned that it was the KITS system itself that was down. It was a planned outage KH needed to perform an update. 

## Note
This is my first exposure to these scripts. While I'm comfortable with dealing with what they do at a technical level (mysql connections, etc), I am unfamiliar with the task they are meant to execute and who the stakeholders are. Any information and guidance about the degree of urgency this issue has or who I may need to speak to about that remote server is very welcome!

## Details
@chiaberry brought it to my attention that an airflow DAG was failing. The ETL in question [is this one](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-kits/blob/production/atd-kits/signal_status_publisher.py) in the `atd-kits` repo. The failure is [found here](https://austininnovation.slack.com/archives/C013G4RNJ01/p1650994984300209?thread_ts=1650994923.293779&cid=C013G4RNJ01), and indicates an issue with the connection to the mysql server running on `10.66.20.157` which provides a mysql database named `KITSDB`. I have spun up a docker container with a mysql client, and I am unable to connect to the server with the following command: `mysql -u ATD_FME_SERVICE -p***** -h 10.66.20.157 -D KITSDB`.

@dianamartin kindly referred us to some folks: "Brian C. if it’s server related. But maybe Lance and Allyson know about it (MMC).", and I have reached out to Brian on teams. I stated:

>[1:08 PM] Hereford, Frank
Brian, how are you doing - I hope well. My name is Frank Hereford and I'm part of the DTS team under Amenity A. (previously John C..)
> One of our integration scripts which connects to a mysql database on 10.66.20.157 to use the KITS_DATABASE there has started to fail with an error. Initially, it through an exception and suggested looking at the server lots, but now I am unable to make a connection to the server at all with a mysql client. 
> Is this something you can help me with, or point me in the right direction?

@chiaberry has disabled the DAG for now, and I will update this issue with more information as I find it.
labels: Type: Bug Report, Impact: 1-Severe, Service: Dev, Need: 1-Must Have, Type: DevOps, Type: Integration

title: Research and Test Auto-Capture Software for Knack Documentation & Training
body:
### Goals 🥅 🚨 
1) Determine if a software solution that automates the task of capturing screenshots and generating descriptions for documentation and training might help the Apps team in the delivery of Knack projects
2) Gather knowledge of which solutions might be the best fit, based on research and testing

### Primary Software Setup and Links 👁️ 👁️

[**TANGO** ](https://www.tango.us/) 
- [x] Free account created Th 6//9/22 (covers Chrome extension, no desktop functionality)
Description: "Press “capture” and Tango turns your process into a step-by-step guide with screenshots and instructions. Capture your work in the browser with the free extension. Upgrade to Pro and capture on Desktop too."

**[SCRIBE](https://scribehow.com/)**
- [x] Free account created Th 6/9/22, with Chrome extension
Description: "Scribe turns any digital process into a step-by-step guide. Simply turn on the Scribe recorder and walk through your process. Scribe automatically creates your step-by-step guide, complete with text and screenshots."
 
**[USERGUIDING](https://userguiding.com/)**
- [x] ~~Free account created Th 6/9/22, with Chrome Extension
Description: "Create a smooth user onboarding experience for your users. Empower your team with the ability to create product tours and guides with no coding."~~

**[IORAD](https://www.iorad.com/)** 
- [x] Free account created Th 6/9/22, with Chrome extension
Description: "Instantly make guided, step-by-step directions for any website directly in the browser."
### Secondary Software Solutions (⏳ permitting)

Crickets... 🦗🦗

### Rejected Software Solutions 🙅‍♀️

**[UIPATH](https://www.uipath.com/)** 
Not testing because they only have a downloadable Windows app
The Task Capture feature/app looked interesting

**[FLEEQ](https://www.fleeq.io/)** 
Not testing this because they offer "bitesize videos" and lack the automation I'm looking for here; this is basically serial Snagit with annotation (take a screenshot, highlight/mark up/annotate, and create a GIF or video of the steps)

**[CLOUDAPP](https://www.getcloudapp.com/)**
Not testing because this looks mainly focused on video and GIF capture, with manually added annotations and feedback options (only?); the product is also download only and I suspect they don't offer a Mac version; the demo is behind a sign-up so I can't get a good sense of the product without giving them my info

**[LOOM](https://www.loom.com/)**
Not testing because while this was suggested as a Scribe alternative, it seems focused on video messaging only

**[BLUEPRINT](https://www.blueprintsys.com/)** 
Not testing because this seems more focused on analysis than documentation, does not offer a free trial, and would require a request for a demo
labels: Service: Apps, Type: Documentation, Type: Research

title: Upgrade Moped to `graphql-engine` 2.7.0 or later
body:
After a Friday afternoon conversation about possible projects which would be fun and unexpected to put in an upcoming Moped PR 666, @mateoclarke came up with a great idea to make it an opportunity to look into upgrading our current version of `graphql-engine` from 1.3 to 2.7+. I had some time to try it out over the weekend, and then this [conversation happened in slack.](https://austininnovation.slack.com/archives/CNUEPKLB1/p1654287743257939)

My first comment: 

>I opened a feature branch, [the devil is in the details](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/tree/the-devil-is-in-the-details), to check out the double-dog-dare of seeing what road blocks would come up with regards to running with the latest release of graphql-engine. :dog2: :guide_dog:
>
>I think we’re in a surprisingly good place — 2.7.0 spun up and worked out of the box for me locally. I can’t get it to break going through each UI view while entering and removing data.
>
>Hasura has written downright [excellent documentation](https://hasura.io/docs/latest/graphql/core/guides/upgrade-hasura-v2/) for this process, and the list of breaking changes is a must read. I’ve gone through each, and I think the only one that has potential to break something in moped is the new support for the updated graphql spec which requires:
>
>[#3: Order of keys in objects passed as “order_by” operator inputs is not preserved](https://hasura.io/docs/latest/graphql/core/guides/upgrade-hasura-v2/#hasura-v2-behaviour-changes)
>
>I have looked at all the instances of order_by in our entire codebase, and I believe that our only use of anything except a single key-value pair occurs in GQLAbstract.js. However, we don’t feed any configurations into GQLAbstract which would cause it to make unordered, tiered order_by configurations so .. :white_check_mark: i think.
>
>Additional reading of the [change-logs](https://github.com/hasura/graphql-engine/releases) going back to the 2.0 release would also be prudent, in particular focusing on any behavior or breaking changes Hasura points out. Luckily, there are few. I’ve brushed through these and don’t see any glaring issues, but I’d want to spend an hour or so carefully inspecting them.
>
>I’d love to discuss any of those behavior changes that anyone thinks could be impactful. It’s my belief that if we were to 1) all :thumbsup: on that list of changes as being safe or understood, and 2) have the app be tested with the testing script that Product maintains, then we could plan for an upgrade in testing, staging and then production.
>
>This was just a fun exercise initially, but I think it has strong potential to be straightforward. I would be happy to spin this conversation into an issue also at anytime. The new graphql-engine is :fire: , it’s notably faster on startup, maybe 2-3X faster and I think it’s noticeable in the app too.

I will snag that PR # when it comes up, and we can discuss the idea generally here and with a more practical consideration in that when it's available. Until then, feel free to browse the changes I have in the branch, [the devil is in the details](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/tree/the-devil-is-in-the-details). It's really nothing, it's super easy to get to where you can test the app just by firing it up after checking it out.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps

title: Add `crash_created` timestamp to `atd_vz_data.public.atd_txdot_crashes`
body:
Adding a timestamp that is set to the current time when a crash record is initially created from the CRIS → VZ ETL would allow for a much easier diagnosis of potential or on-going issues with the ETL itself. This will allow for quicker and more informed responses to crash ingest issues.


I propose this be run on the database. The data will self populate as new records are created and no changes are required to any other portions of the suite. 
```
ALTER TABLE atd_txdot_crashes ADD COLUMN crash_record_created timestamp DEFAULT now();
```

title: [Feature] - [TIA - Determination Form] - Final Customer Email w/ Attachment Link
body:
### It would be great if KNACK would allow me to email the customer a copy of the final signed determination form when I'm saving my review decision. Currently I have to use Outlook to email the customer with the signed form attached.

**Known Limitation:** KNACK cannot currently add attachments to automated emails. 

**Solution:** Make the signed form attachment publicly viewable, then we can create an automated email with a link to the attachment. 

**Next Steps:** Discovery
- Consideration: Do we need to limit public access to just the customer, or is it ok if somehow the public finds the URL and sees the attachment?
labels: Type: Feature, Service: Apps, Need: 2-Should Have, Workgroup: TDS, Product: TDS Portal

title: [Enhancement] Prevent whitespace in manually-entered 311 service request numbers
body:
Bill S. @ 311 reports that our XML activity messages from the Data occasionally contain leading/trailing whitespace:

> Motorola Solutions is asking us to review the XML sent by Knack. The KNACK interface periodically sends PRC numbers with an added space before the number. This causes issues when processing on the CSR side.

I was able to identify one such SR, `  22-00063074`. This can happen when an MMC user manually creates a 311 service request in the Data Tracker, which can be necessary during periods when the 311 <> Data Tracker integration is down.

We need to prevent/trim this whitespace to ensure that updates to this SR in Data Tracker can be sent correctly to 311.
labels: Workgroup: AMD, Impact: 1-Severe, Service: Apps, Type: Enhancement, Product: AMD Data Tracker

title: Add ability to create invoices
body:
During the sprint review on August 26th, a discussion about how the SM team was generating invoices came up. @dianamartin said that it was possible to create invoices in Knack and demoed an example from Sign Fabrication.

Currently, invoices for permits and impounds are created in-house, then emailed out. Trip fees are created by Finance. 

Because we can create invoices in Knack, adding that functionality to the Fees/Payments page would enhance the workflow for staff who normally create invoices.

title: TIA Historical Mitigation Data Tracking Solution
body:
- As a department, ATD needs to track $15-$20 million in TIA Mitigation Data that existed before the TIA Mod was built. 

 - As a TIA Mitigation fee program manager, I need to provide my mitigation fee data to all interested stakeholders, and in a way that allows the stakeholders to answer their own questions about the data. 

 - As a stakeholder needing to fund transportation improvements, I need access to all possible funding sources, including historical mitigation fees collected. 


----

- [x] Scoping Meeting
- [ ] Builder Huddle
- [ ] Determine if this will go the project or feature track
- [ ] Next Steps...


------
`DTS Ticket Submittal by Nelson E.`
<!-- Email -->
<!-- Nelson.Esike@austintexas.gov -->

> Name

Nelson E.

> What application are you using?

Other / Not Sure

> Describe the problem.

It will be useful as a reference point for city employees who wants to leverage available fiscal for their project instead of reaching out to me for any question they might have. 

> Describe the solution you have in mind.

We a considering creating a SharePoint or GIS database (whichever works best) of TIA fiscal and Fee in -lieu database for internal consumption. When completed, it will be share to all city stakeholders to alert them of available funds that can be leveraged for their transportation related projects.

I had a quick meeting with Diana Martin who advised I submit this SR

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

By the share use of the URL

> Users

CPO, ATD, PW, DSD etc

> Sponsorship

Eric Bollich 

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

['Safety', 'Condition of transportation-related infrastructure']

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

['Health & Safety — Protect Austinites by lowering the risk of travel-related injury and promoting public health.', 'Sustainability — Promote integrated designs and quality additions to the built environment while reducing impacts and promoting efficient use of public resources.', 'Placemaking — Build a transportation network that encourages social interaction through quality urban design, and connects users to the many places that make Austin unique.', 'Economic Prosperity — Promote economic growth for individuals and the city through strategic investments in transportation networks that meet the needs of the 21st century.', 'Innovation — Draw inspiration from forward-looking cities around the world, change the way we think about what’s possible, and set an example for the rest of the country.']

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

We are currently using excel spreadsheet which is not idea for such large scale data

> Is there anything else we should know?

September 2021

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

TDS have something similar but theirs is strictly Fee in-lieu from 2018- 2021. Mine is older fiscal and fee in lieu from 1984-2021  

> Requested By
Nelson E.

[Attachment](https://api.knack.com/v1/applications/595d00ebd315cc4cb98daff4/download/asset/60f06579f011b50020b13708/unifiedtiafiscalsfinancemissingfiscal.xlsx) (3.1mb)

title: Move trips data; Add transactional data to update Fees/Payments page
body:
During the Thursday, Aug 26th Sprint Review, the Shared Mobility Team discussed making the following improvements to the Fees/Payments page. 

- Move "Trip Data" to a new tab with a new URL
- Add transactional data to the Fees/Payment page.


Currently, Providers pay a lump sum every six months for all the permits they're renewing. That amount is captured in under the "Monthly Trip Fee Payment Tracking" section of the page.

As an addition or replacement, Staff would like to have a table that tracks ongoing transactions/payments by Provider, which includes the number of total permits being renewed, and monthly payment for per/trip fees on the Fees/Permits page.

@dianamartin referenced an achieved license page that we might be able to use to show past transactions. 

[Miro board ](https://miro.com/app/board/o9J_l4LSuvE=/)showing the table relationships.
labels: Type: Feature, Impact: 2-Major, Service: Apps, Need: 1-Must Have, Workgroup: SMO, Product: Smart Mobility Office

title: Training on Badge System: C Cure 9000
body:
You can’t be on the city network to access it. Billy said Brian tried and it didn’t work. I too on notes on my phone.

# C Cure 9000

- Brian Craig and Billy only have access
- Diana was taught by Billy

- Need 2 screens, never close (not sure how to get them back up)
- Enter last name to query user
- Click Enter
- Brings up names in table results
- We don’t delete names, but credentials
- Double click on name

First 3 tabs used

`General` tab

- First name
- Last name
- Personnel type: AMD, ATD
(Click the Three dots advanced sort feature, can export the file)

`Credentials` tab
- Card Number
- Badge number

`Clearances` tab
- See Clearance Groups below
- Ex. ALL ACCESS 24/7

## Removing User/Access

- Remove card number under Credentials tab
- Remove clearances under Clearances tab
- Right click on User's Name, Click Delete employee

## 1st way to add new access (If Badge ID is email to Billy)
- Click Add Employee
- Click New
- Enter First name and Last name
- Personnel
- Add Card access number
- Click Enter

*If shows up in cell it takes the info, sometimes it doesn’t

- Add Clearances
- Click Save and close
- Email David that it’s done

## 2nd way to add a new access (if physical badge is available, Badge ID is unknown)

- Scan card to see who the badged user is
- Able to know the card number from the queue (shows up at the bottom of the list)
- Follow steps in 1st way to add new user (Add Name, Personnel, Clearances)
- Click Save and Close
- Go to front door at 8900, Close and try to open the front door
- Then done!

## Clearance Groups

**AMD:**
8700, gates, all doors except server rooms
8900, gates, all doors except server rooms

**ATD:** (Mirror of AMD)
8700, gates, all doors except server rooms
8900, gates, all doors except server rooms

**Gates only:** trash trucks, mowing people (Never handed our cards or fobs)

**S&M** change to **SMB** later: 8900 front north, 2 back doors, and 8900 gate (Thinks to be a DUP of ATD/AMD)

**Testing:** no idea

**TMC:** only the front north door 8700, only during business hours, 7 days a week

**Visitors:** suppose to be only front south door

## Other Notes
- Brian has poked around to modify the system, he might know more things about it
**Reports**: Door access report (PDF report)

*Pro tip: enter random name so I know if it been touched since I was last there.

**Power Outage?** 
- System goes out people can’t get into building
- There are keys to enter the building: Joe Mike, 2 other keys
- Supposed to be David and Billy, but they didn’t get one. (Non-copy-able keys)
labels: Workgroup: AMD, Workgroup: DTS, Service: Apps, Type: Operations, Project: Desk Reservation Solution

title: VZE: Change Motorized Conveyance filter to exclude Motorcycles and include Scooters
body:
After chatting with Xavier after the August sprint review, we learned that filtering for Units Involved needed to be corrected. 

Motorized Conveyances should not include motorcycles, and scooters are being defined as "Pedestrian" in some cases when they should be "Motorized Conveyances." 

In order to correct this inconsistency, we need to change the unit_desc_id for "Pedestrian" to reflect different filtering. 

**Current Filtering**
unit_desc_id = 1 and veh_body_styl_id not in (71, 90) then "Motor Vehicle",
unit_desc_id = 1 and veh_body_styl_id in (71, 90) then "Motorcycle",
unit_desc_id = 3 then "Bicyclist", 
unit_desc_id in (4,5) then "Pedestrian"

**Change**
unit_desc_id = 4 then "Pedestrian"
unit_desc_id = 5 then "Motorized Conveyance"   <= this set already includes scooters as is.

**New**
unit_desc_id = 1 and veh_body_styl_id not in (71, 90) then “Motor Vehicle”,
unit_desc_id = 1 and veh_body_styl_id in (71, 90) then “Motorcycle”,
unit_desc_id = 3 then “Bicyclist”,
unit_desc_id = 4 then “Pedestrian”
unit_desc_id = 5 then “Motorized Conveyance” <= this set already includes scooters as is.


![Screen Shot 2021-08-30 at 12.11.56 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5d68810b05d7792664be403f/bbeba4df-462a-48ad-b7c4-04a2d28c08bb)

title: Ability to select a signal asset when editing project components
body:
As a Moped user, I would like to define a project component by selecting a signal asset from a list so that I can create new components quickly without entering redundant asset information.

### Functional reqs:
- Ability to select from a list of signals when creating or editing a project component
- If signal is selected, the component subtype should take the value of the selected signal ("PHB" or "Traffic")
- Component location should be automatically set to the location of the signal

### Notes
- This feature extends similar functionality available with #7073.
- Will need to address that the "Signal" component type has four subtypes: traffic, PHB, RRFB, and school beacon. Selecting RRFB and school beacon assets is **out of scope**. The best solution is probably to move both RRFB and school beacons to their own component type. Or as a subtype of "Signage"
labels: Type: Feature, Service: Dev, Product: Moped, Project: Moped v1.0

title: Ability to define new project from signal asset
body:
As a Moped user, I would like to define my project's details by selecting a signal asset so that I can create new projects quickly without entering redundant asset information. 

Functional reqs:
- Ability to select from a list of signals when creating project
- If signal is selected, project name should take name of signal name
- If signal is selected, project component should be automatically created as a "signal" (not "generic") component with correct subtype ("Traffic" or "PHB")
- Enforce validation: either project name or signal must be populated
- Disable map editing when user has selected a signal — component feature will be created automatically


In scope:
- select a signal from the new project workflow

Out of scope:
- Select a signal when adding a component on the Map tab
labels: Workgroup: AMD, Type: Feature, Service: Dev, Product: Moped, Project: Moped v1.0

title: Automate Cost of Services (COS) Monthly Reporting
body:
Automate cost of service (COS) reporting. Users must be able to download, on demand, two reports:

- a transaction report which can be uploaded into the AIMs system to transfer funds from other departments to ATD. This is the "JVD" report
- a report which itemizes fees that will be charged to each department, and can be provided to each department for review before processing the transactions in AIMS. Let's call this the "Department Report"


### Resources:
- [Miro board](https://miro.com/app/board/o9J_lrnxMhs=/) with basic data flow
- [Google sheet](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/132IH0tTLHp9KeuWYN9xhTY7cmad6ojam64jzvU5phPE/edit#gid=983197605) with report template and field mappings
- [Github repo](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-cost-of-service-reporting)


### Todo:
- [x] Develop AMANDA SQL Queries
- [x] Develop Knack queries
- [x] Create a sample JVD Report **with real data** for staff review
- [x] Create a sample Department Report **with real data** for staff review
- [x] Write ETL scripts
- [x] Set up database pipeline/infrastructure
- [ ] Determine how reports will be delivered. A UI would be nice, but an email may have to suffice in the near term.
labels: Workgroup: Finance, Workgroup: ROW, Type: Data, Type: Reports, Product: AMANDA, Project: FY22 AMANDA Fee Updates

Data Tracker

Preferably soon, by October when we start the new fiscal year.

title: Create Models to Enhance and Standardize Processing
body:
Creating models for this process will help standardize data processing and break apart data into working categories. This is essential because some categories of data can be processed through automation while others will need to be manually reviewed before processing

**Data Categories:**

_Attribute Changes_
- Joins to CTN by segment ID
- Does not joint to CTN by segment ID

_Geometry Changes_
- Added features - should be able to be appended
- Deleted features
- Updated features - Manual review needed
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Type: Data, Service: Geo

title: [Enhancement] Project Status Badge
body:
### UI & Triggers
- Add menu items for "Place on hold" and "Cancel", see below
![New Summary Page – 3 0 – Cancel project](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/135399309-630ad621-53c3-49e0-aa85-5f882a33afda.png)
- Display status as a badge at the top of the project - design specs in #7492


## Background
The use of the project "Status" field is confusing. It's options are:
- Active
- Potential
- Cancelled
- On hold
- Completed
- Archived

Meanwhile, we have phase names which feed into the "Current Phase" attribute and serve a similar purpose. "Potential" and "Complete" are both Phase names.

### Initial proposal
- Show the status as a badge, a 
- Simplify the project Status field to these values
   - Active
   - On hold
   - Cancelled
- Default status is "Active". Users can place a project on hold or cancel it in the upper righthand menu at the top of a project page. 
![New Summary Page – 3 0 – Cancel project](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/135399309-630ad621-53c3-49e0-aa85-5f882a33afda.png)
- Cancelled projects are hidden from the "All projects" listing.
labels: Service: Dev, Epic, Type: Enhancement, Product: Moped, Project: Moped v1.0

title: ProjectView: Fix various DOM warnings
body:
[This](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/a249dc69e4037e7ed7a43521dc3f76ef229a565d/moped-editor/src/views/projects/projectView/TabPanel.js#L18) use of `` wraps the children of tab components in a `

` element, resulting in a linter error for invalid DOM nesting. The task is to move the use of Typography further down the chain for elements that need it. At a quick glance, it seems that the `ProjectSummary` component is the only tab which actually needs it. The GridTable component is also throwing warnings because of a handful of invalid component props: `fullWidth` and `labelId`

title: [SMB] Feature - Cost Estimate Form & Invoices
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- christina.tremel@austintexas.gov -->

> What application are you using?

Signs & Markings Operations

> Describe the problem.

Would like to develop a cost estimate form that can be used to calculate cost estimates for both signs and markings. 

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

We would like the cost estimate page to look very similar to what we have existing on our "Invoice Details" pages and would the printed forms to look very similar to the invoice documents we have in Knack already. This would be the central place that Supervisors, office staff, and the sign shop could all use for creating cost estimates for other Divisions/Departments. 

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

We have several excel forms floating around with cost estimate details. The problem with these documents is that it's difficult to keep all of the spreadsheets updated with accurate costs. 

> Requested By
Christina T.

title: Design Feedback on Vision Zero Viewer MVP
body:
## Background

### Vision Zero

Vision Zero is the city's strategy to eliminate all traffic fatalities and serious injuries, while increasing safe, healthy, equitable mobility for all. Through a combination of safer street design, targeted law enforcement, evidence-based public policy, thoughtful public engagement, and participation from our community, the City of Austin can ensure our streets are safe for everyone.

### Vision Zero Viewer

The City of Austin Transportation Department has been developing a suite of open-source software tools to help our department and community understand where crashes are most likely to occur. Inspired by NYC's open-source Vision Zero Viewer [project](http://www.nycvzv.info/), our goal is to provide users with easy-to-understand visualizations of crashes occurring within Austin city limits.

[Vision Zero Viewer](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/blob/master/atd-vzv/README.md) is part of our [Vision Zero Crash Data System](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data), which also includes:

 - [Vision Zero Database](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/blob/master/atd-vzd/README.md) 
 - [Vision Zero Editor](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/blob/master/atd-vze/README.md)

### Users

The target audience for the Vision Zero Viewer is:
 - Austin residents
 - Transportation safety activists
 - Local and national journalists
 - Industry experts

 Our goal is to provide the audience with tools to better understand the landscape of traffic fatalities and serious injuries in Austin. With the viewer, we hope to answer the following questions:

 - How many traffic fatalities and serious injuries are occurring in Austin? - Where are traffic fatalities and serious injuries occurring in Austin? - When are traffic fatalities and serious injuries most likely to occur?
 - What transportation modes are more likely to be involved in traffic fatalities and serious injuries?
 - Are traffic fatalities and serious injuries affecting a disproportionate number of people of a certain demographic?
 - What is the human impact of traffic fatalities and serious injuries?
 - **Are we making progress in achieving our Vision Zero goals?**

## Design

- Staging site: https://visionzero-staging.austinmobility.io/viewer/
- [XD doc for in-place comments](https://xd.adobe.com/view/316b4a94-f15d-46b0-5e8c-1a7df8ed16b8-475a/grid/)

## Our ask + caveats

So far, our work on Vision Zero Viewer has focused on basic dashboard functionality for core Vision Zero metrics. We've also used it as a tool to identify refinements to the overall Vision Zero Crash Data System scripts and data architecture. 

We are in the process of adding a Design Researcher to our team in the near future and performing user research and usability testing for VZV will be among their first projects. 

Further, we have not:

- Optimized for mobile. 
- Undertaken [accessibility compliance](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/issues/583). (Though we are thrilled that both a vision-impaired resident and hearing-impaired resident — both of whom serve on the Pedestrian Advisory Council — have volunteered to test with us once our Design researcher is on board.)  

Tl;dr there is still a lot of work to be done so we're not looking to invest heavily in changes right now. That said, we know there is some low-hanging fruit as is and would also love advice/resources for future work. 

## Questions

- Color recommendations would be especially helpful at this point in time:
  - Recommendations on distinct colors for visualizations with 5+ categories, e.g. the *Race and Ethnicity* tab of the *Demographics* chart? 
  - Can you reccomend any existing high-accessiblity and/or legibility color palettes that we should look at adopting?
- Where should we outline our methodology and disclaimers on how we collected and refined crash data?
- Should we make the "Fatalities/Serious Injuries" controls  in the summary page global rather than per component?
- How can we improve the text content?

*Migrated from [atd-vz-data #694](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/issues/694)*
labels: Service: Product, Type: Research, Workgroup: VZ, Product: Vision Zero Viewer

title: Project: Mobility Project Viewer 1.0
body: How might we make information about Austin's mobility projects easily accessible to stakeholders and the community? ## Research phase _Performed by [Janet Chu](https://janetchuhl.com/) as a [Civic Innovation Corps](https://www.codingitforward.com/corps) member, June-August 2021_ - [Mobility Project Viewer: Preliminary Research](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/e/2PACX-1vQWhZoHOAYJI3AGk51FTx3t2SUcAyUjXnNnRl6RhYc_fZdZjHLFaDDElC5GzPMr8tCj6LEVAYTkK5cm/pub?start=false&loop=false&delayms=3000) - summary presentation - [Mobility Project Viewer Miro board](https://miro.com/app/board/o9J_l_y7IaA=/) - research and ideation - [Janet's portfolio case study](https://janetchuhl.com/austin-mobility-viewer/) ![MobilityProjectViewerMiro](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/131399608-027f04f2-054b-4920-a072-b8954f433106.jpg) ### Existing/related solutions - [Interim Mobility Project Database Viewer](https://austin.maps.arcgis.com/apps/webappviewer/index.html?id=d6194f783b114453a70eb769853e390c) — Built and maintained by Active Transportation for CoA-internal mobility project coordination, data from the Interim Mobility Project (Access) Database / ArcGIS Online - [Capital Projects Explorer](https://capitalprojects.austintexas.gov/projects) — all capital-funded City of Austin projects including mobility infrastructure projects from IMPDB - [TXDOT Project Tracker](https://apps3.txdot.gov/apps-cq/project_tracker/) - [Development Tracker](https://developmenttracker.austintexas.gov/) — Development Services / Tyler Tech ### City of Austin mobility project communications - [Mobility projects at Data.austin.gov](https://data.austintexas.gov/stories/s/2016-Mobility-Bond/9krn-a66r/) - Socrata "Perspectives" - [2020 Mobility Annual Plan](https://www.austintexas.gov/sites/default/files/files/2020_Mobility_Annual_Plan.pdf) - PDF - [Austin Transportation Projects on Austintexas.gov](http://austintexas.gov/department/transportation/projects) - ArcGIS Online Story Maps — e.g. [South Pleasant Valley Road](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/c8eef2a96c88489c92010a63d0944881), [Safe for All](https://austin.maps.arcgis.com/home/item.html?id=4a57b61a0dc9444a9d117dc69f3a898e) - [Twitter](https://twitter.com/austinmobility) + [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/ATXTransportation) - [Austin Mobility News](https://mailchi.mp/austintexas/austin-mobility-news-2021-05-24) ## System context In relation to [Moped](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/#307 ), née Mobility Project Database ![MopedOverview6_2021](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/131400222-f3d7fa22-a123-4f42-adff-c6a75eca632e.png)

title: Project: Parking Meters Work Order System
body:
Parking Enterprise needs a data tracker solution for work orders on service and installation of new and existing bike racks. This app can be a simplified copy of the existing markings or signs data tracker app
**Note: Scope may include a work order tracking solution for the entire work group, not just for this specific use case.**

## Background

Parking Enterprise is focusing on collecting the location of all the bike racks to perform subsequent site inspections. From this, they'll track repairs and installation on a feature service in AGOL.

## Desired Outcome
The solution is successful if we can track the work orders and materials used per bike rack.

Users
* Customers/Stakeholders Are: David D, David S

Submitted by Alan 

Describe the problem.
> Parking Enterprise needs a data tracker solution for work orders on service and installation of new and existing bike racks


Describe the solution you have in mind.
> This app can be a simplified copy of the existing markings or signs data tracker app

How will we know that our solution is successful?
> The solution is successful if we can track the work orders and materials used per bike rack.

Users
> DTS, PE, ATSD

Sponsorship
> PE

Would this application affect any of the Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators?
> Accessibility to and equity of multi-modal transportation choices,Condition of transportation-related infrastructure

Would this application support any of the Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals?
> Commuter Delay – Reduce the amount of time workers spend traveling between home and work.,Travel Choice — Promote a balanced transportation network and the ability to make informed choices based on personal needs and preferences.,Affordability — Lower the cost of traveling in Austin by providing affordable travel options.,Sustainability — Promote integrated designs and quality additions to the built environment while reducing impacts and promoting efficient use of public resources.,Placemaking — Build a transportation network that encourages social interaction through quality urban design, and connects users to the many places that make Austin unique.

Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.
> The project is currently in scoping. Parking Enterprise is focusing on collecting the location of all the bike racks to perform subsequent site inspections. From this, they'll track repairs and installation on a feature service in AGOL.

How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 
> DTS created data trackers for Signs and Markings

title: Project: Moped v1.0
workgroups: AMD, VZ, PWD, Finance, PD, ATD, SDD, TED, OOD, ATSD, PIO, TDS, PE, CPO, SMB, ROW
body:
Moped 1.0 is the inaugural release of [Moped](https://www.austinmobility.io/products/5086), our shared platform for Austin Transportation and partners to manage the City of Austin's complete portfolio of mobility infrastructure projects. ## Background The City of Austin has a diverse portfolio of mobility infrastructure projects. These are currently tracked in various platforms — from simple spreadsheets administered by a single workgroup to bespoke enterprise software that tracks capital-funded projects. Without a centralized system of record, cross-workgroup coordination is challenging, analysis and reporting capabilities are limited, and resources are not used with maximum efficiency. ## Scope This inaugural Moped release will provide a shared platform for Austin Transportation and partners to manage the City of Austin's complete portfolio of mobility infrastructure projects. Moped 1.0 will include all the features and infrastructure needed to support an organization-wide transition to a single application to manage their projects. As a result, core project data and we will publish a rich, high-quality dataset to leverage in public-facing viewers, BI platforms, and more. The following capabilities, outside our current scope of work, will be considered for future Moped releases or constitute independent products in the Moped ecosystem: - Integrate mobility-related project data from partner organizations like CapMetro, TXDOT, and others who own and manage mobility-related projects in Austin. - Establishing an [authoritative geography](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1lrglPFdwX4qsOB2iIWk3WsFyOljSmOgq-qqOeiwa7MQ/edit) for department-wide use. - Creating a GIS tool with capabilities beyond the basic feature editing/creation that ArcGIS does now. (Users must currently define features by drawing them freehand, but a future tool would allow users to select individual points, lines, and features from the authoritative geography and tie them to a project.) - Building a public-facing [mobility project explorer](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/1106). ## Outcomes and Deliverables | Desired outcomes | What success looks like | Deliverables | | ------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------ | ------------------------------------------------------------ | | The City of Austin tracks its complete mobility project portfolio and mobility activities of partner entities on a shared platform. | • Interdepartmental use of the same tool

• Ability to tell the full story of mobility activities in Central Texas

• Platform tailored to mobility planning, project/program development, and asset tracking | • Enterprise relational georeferenced database • Published live mobility projects lists and maps | | Systems are integrated so that data flows between them rather than being replicated. | • Data entered once

• Automation keeps data sets up to date in multiple systems (e.g. upon project completion or pulling real-time financials)

• Consistent information across channels and systems — from public reports to eCapris | • Standardized naming conventions and data type

• Integration with eCapris (capital projects), budget, asset inventories, and partner entity project databases | | Data is available to inform decision-making for mobility planning, project management, and business process improvement. | • Accurate live data is available and well-structured for business intelligence, analysis (mobility, equity, etc.), reporting, and mapping

• Flexible data framework as needs evolve | • User roles, permissions, and structures that support appropriate levels of access and consumption for reliable security, stability, maintenance, QAQC, and data retention. | | Platform to facilitate effective and efficient project and program management | • Workflows and structures to support coordination across teams for projects

• Flexible cost estimation tools in a centralized platform for consistency and quality

• Tracking of funding sources not yet in our financial system (developer contribution or by partners) | • Tracking and workflows to support reviews, agreements, work orders, data collection requests, date tracking, update alerts | ![Planning-and-analysis](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/62583080-58614e80-b874-11e9-850d-2a8bda07c0fc.jpeg) ## Roadmap ![2022-02-07_Moped-Roadmap](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/152878935-1581bbcf-f74b-4490-96c2-ac5c6f5e7470.png) --- This Github issue represents a project of Austin Transportation's [Data & Technology Services](https://austinmobility.io/) team. Project status is documented regularly in the comments below.
labels: Workgroup: ATSD, Workgroup: AMD, Workgroup: Finance, Workgroup: OOD, Workgroup: PE, Workgroup: PIO, Workgroup: ROW, Workgroup: SMB, Workgroup: SDD, Workgroup: TED, Service: Product, Workgroup: PWD, Workgroup: CPO, Workgroup: VZ, Product: Moped, Workgroup: TDS, Workgroup: ATD, Project Index, Featured Project, Project: Moped v1.0, Workgroup: PD

- The document is saved as a new Illustrator file
- New layers for legend/art are created, legend/art are loaded into these
- PDF drafts are created to review as needed

title: Product: Vision Zero Crash Data System
body:
A unified platform for reviewing and augmenting vehilce crash data from Austin's regional reporting agencies.

![Screen Shot 2021-01-19 at 12.25.50 PM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5dc05535495c1e0001182c16/b327b6d9-2457-47c4-979d-d1bec97d5736)

### Login

To login to the Vision Zero Editor, click [here](https://visionzero.austin.gov/editor/). 

### Support

For questions or help resolving an issue with the Vision Zero Editor, submit a service request to the Data & Technology Services Team [here](https://atd.knack.com/dts#new-service-request/).

### Background & Context

The Vision Zero Crash Data System centralizes and streamlines the management of Austin Transportations's [Vision Zero](https://austintexas.gov/department/vision-zero) data. The system [consumes and processes](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/tree/master/atd-etl) vehicle crash data, most prominently from [TxDOT's Crash Records Information System (CRIS)](https://www.txdot.gov/government/enforcement/crash-statistics.html) and Austin Police Department, and loads it into the [Vision Zero Database](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data/blob/master/atd-vzd/README.md). Analysts on the Vision Zero team can then review, correct, and enhance the data via the Vision Zero Editor 

This robust data is then used to identify [high-injury roadways](https://austin.maps.arcgis.com/apps/View/index.html?appid=9d133c89a7944d589e55123aba0ee07f), [prioritize](https://storymaps.arcgis.com/stories/4a57b61a0dc9444a9d117dc69f3a898e) [safety improvements](https://austintexas.gov/page/programs-and-initiatives), and track the impact of our efforts. It is [available online](https://data.austintexas.gov/Transportation-and-Mobility/Vision-Zero-Crash-Report-Data/y2wy-tgr5) and also accessible via the [Vision Zero Viewer](https://visionzero.austin.gov/viewer/).

### Technology
Technologies, libraries, and languages used for this project include:
- Docker
- Hasura
- PostgreSQL
- React (Javascript)
- Core UI (HTML & CSS)
- Python

### Resources
- [Github repo](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-vz-data)
- [Drive folder](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1W8FuMe7HdO7NTsMAjw7IPlNaxYwS92c3?usp=sharing)
- [DTS Portal issue](https://atd.knack.com/dts#dts-team-portal/view-issue-details/5c9d30365b4bac2ffe6f0ac4/)

---
This Github issue represents a product of Austin Transportation's [Data & Technology Services](https://product.austinmobility.io/) team.

<!-- Don't forget to add a new "Project:" label here: https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/labels. Use the hex code #3D3D3D. -->

title: Update the `graphql-engine` version in the Moped stack to `2.11.*`
body:
Copied from [an initial slack thread](https://austininnovation.slack.com/archives/CNUEPKLB1/p1662740330053719):

> This is an issue proposing an upgrade to `graphql-engine` `2.11.1` (up from `2.7.1`, I believe) during our next scheduled moped release. The update would apply fixes for a number of bugs they have identified and add a handful of features. None of the changes listed in the release notes (from an albeit quick read) stick out to me as making this urgent, so I would consider this a matter of maintaining best practices.
The patch itself would be ~ 5 lines and the AWS configuration change can be done without downtime while the netlify build takes place during the launch party.

As this is our first nominal, non-major upgrade, I think expanding this to include the creation of a checklist of actions to put in GitBook is appropriate as well. I'm going to bump this to a `1` to include that work. I'm thinking really like a paragraph or two tops and a < 10 item checklist is all we'll need to avoid a knowledge silo around the process.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 4-None, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Type: Enhancement, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps, Type: Snackoo 🍫

- [ ] Spreadsheets emailed from Finance
- [ ] AE Number of records to update:

- [ ] AW Number of records to update: 
- [ ] CPO Number of records to update: 
- [ ] PWD Number of records to update: 
- [ ] WS Number of records to update: 
- [ ] Total Number of records being updated: 
- [ ] Remove non-JV filtered tabs from spreadsheets and remove any rows without `Journal Voucher ID` if necessary
- [ ] Save all 6 spreadsheets as csv. It also helps to save an All Data Excel file if you have to check for data inaccuracies after importing.
- [ ] Import (Update) records, match on `Fee Number` & import `Journal Voucher ID`. Set `Import Date` to today [(Review Instructions)](https://atd-dts.gitbook.io/atd-knack-operations/row-portal/cos-jv-update)
- [ ] Make sure the number of records being updated matches for all spreadsheets
- [ ] Filter records by `Import Date` and make sure the total number of records updated matches
- [ ] If inaccurate, check backend filter to see if any of the unmatched records are archived records and marked as `is_archived`. The AMANDA data may be inaccurate, the script may be running incorrectly, or the `Fee Numbers` may be incorrect if the record amount does not match the number of Archived records.
- [ ] Also check for duplicate `Fee Numbers` which could be duplicate records or have the wrong fee number. These need to be reconciled with Finance.
- [ ] Email Finance (and others cc'd) that the update task is complete

title: [BUG] Two moped users' IDs are not unique
body:
In production, Amenity's `moped_users.staff_uuid` is the same as Renee's `moped_users.cognito_user_id`.

This is probably the result of manual editing of our users table in the early days of Moped.

I'm not sure there are any significant impacts from this, since the ID columns are used for different purposes. But it definitely confused us when debugging the activity log in https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/9642

I do not know what the best solution is to this. After a _quick_ scan of our editor code i do not see the `staff_uuid` anywhere, so the easiest solution may be to issue Amenity a new staff UUID. I defer to @mddilley @frankhereford and @chiaberry.
labels: Type: Bug Report, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Product: Moped

title: [Feature] ArcGIS Online (AGOL) integration
body:
As a Moped user, I need access to my project data in ArcGIS Online so that I can create maps and analyses.

### In scope
- A daily ETL process which pushes moped **component** data into ArcGIS Online

### Out of scope
- #3672 
- A post-processed "projects" layer that transforms points to lines so that they can be represented in a single layer.

### Notes
- [This script](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/pull/779) should be useful
- [This script](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-knack-services/blob/production/services/records_to_agol.py) provides an example of pushing data through the ArcGIS REST API
- We should hold off on this work until #9675 is complete
- See also #10189

##  Users are unable to click the red invoice amount and it show them the fees and violations for any related folders

On the Folder and People Tab, when an applicant has an Overdue Fee/Violation red pill/button, users used to be able to click on it and it would show the Overdue fees and/or any violations that user/property has on any folder in AMANDA. AMANDA is not longer showing this.

When the activate upon payment function is yes for DS permits, once they make a payment and the permit gets issued.

### Mansueto Institute

- Urban Science - there are discoverable, verifiable truths about urban systems that hold true across geographic, temporal, and cultural spectrums

**Projects**
- [millionneighborhoods.org](https://millionneighborhoods.org/)
- [communityhdi.org](http://communityhdi.org/)

_Fletcher Beaudoin_

title: [SCOPING] Create Auto-Assign Functionality for Court Case Review
body:
**On 9/1/22, Darren U. asked via email:**
"Instead of manually assigning a review to a peer and supervisor – could we create a button that will “automatically assign” it to both Peer Review (Gary or Nick) and Supervisor (Darren and Blake) once you hit that button?" 

**@KaroEngstrom  responded via email:**
"I’m creating an issue for the this automatic assign option so I can bring in Tracy and we can scope that out. The way we have the review process mapped out now is one peer review > approval > one supervisor review > approval. 
I think our questions would include:
- Would you want the system to randomly pick a peer and supervisor reviewer? 
- Would peer and supervisor reviews happen subsequently (as mapped now) or at the same time?"

---

@TracyLinder My concern here is for multiple reviewers at one level (two supervisors) and multiple reviewers simultaneously (send to peer and supervisor at the same time). The ask was not clear on if those would be required. 
Our current model assumes a simple path: 
- Original submitter selects Peer Reviewer from dropdown >
- Upon approval, Peer Reviewer selects Supervisor Reviewer from dropdown >
- Upon approval, Supervisor sends the case back to original submitter
labels: Workgroup: ROW, Type: Feature, Type: Data, Service: Apps, Product: ROW Portal, Product: ATD Knack Services, Provider: Knack

title: [BUG] Knack Data Tracker sync is broken in test
body:
The "Sync with Data Tracker" feature does not work in non-production Moped environments.

The issue is that the Knack record IDs we pull from Socrata only match the Data Tracker production system. When we try send a Knack record ID to test, it is not known to Knack and the request fails with a `500` error.

This feature was once working—Knack would just ignore the invalid value we sent over, but Knack has seemingly tightened their API and is rejecting our POST requests with invalid record IDs.

Two possible solutions:
- create a test version of our Signals socrata dataset that has signal IDs which match our test environment
- modify our javscript to drop the Knack ID of signal records when using the test environment.
labels: Type: Bug Report, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Product: Moped

title: Contact CTM and request an update to the ESB error email distribution list
body:
Currently, when the ESB (which is the messaging service that conveys 311 CSRs to Knack via the `knack-proxy` server), becomes unable to open a network socket to our host, it generates an error message and sends it out via email. These are delivered to @johnclary, `ATDAMDESBNotifications@austintexas.gov` and Robert F. at CTM. 

Our team has reached out to them to add new folks to the list, but the task has not been resolved. John has used an email forwarding rule to distribute them internally to our team in the past, but this issue seeks to form less brittle solution of having the messages be sent to appropriate folks from the ESB itself. 

### Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] From a list of who should receive these. I propose @chiaberry, @dianamartin, @johnclary, @frankhereford, and @mddilley. 
- [ ] Request the change to Robert F. 
- [ ] Confirm at the next outage that the alerting is distributed as planned
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Service: Apps, Need: 2-Should Have, Type: DevOps, Type: Integration

Some feature to identify if a Knack or Amanda permit or CSR is for bike or scooter hub maintenance such as a bike rack or scooter micro-mobility hub 

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

A button or selection field when submitting to label the item as a micro mobility bike or scooter related item because hours are wasted having to open every single one to see if the body of a permit or CSR is for that type of submittal.  Meter Shop is not a large group, and they come in at 4AM. So this would save lots of time.

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

There are no work arounds, just opening every single one to identify in the body if it is for bikes, scooter micro mobility type hub permit or maintenance.

> Is there anything else we should know?

Preferably a week because there are no work arounds, just opening every single one to identify in the body if it is for bikes, scooter micro mobility type hub permit or maintenance. This wastes a major amount of time for employees without this feature. 

> Requested By
Jeffrey B.

title: [Feature] Placemaking Program Management
body:
Related to #10045 

<!-- Email -->
<!-- luke.urie@austintexas.gov -->

> Name

Luke Urie 

> What application are you using?

Other / Not Sure

> Describe the problem.

The importance and need of developing a management methodology through Placemaking is essential to have a user-friendly interface to manage processes, collaborate seamlessly with team members, automate tasks, and track key milestones. This becomes important as placemaking sub-programs are expanding and becoming more complex with limited resources. Additionally, there have been some complications with the current application form and intake process currently in place. The intake form currently places all submissions together, rather than separating each intake application. 

> Describe the solution you have in mind.

Looking for more information about The Knack and how it may support and track key milestones for the internal and external agencies. 

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

A user-friendly platform that can be used by internal and external agencies to track key milestones. The ability to track beyond when applications come in, but the need for lengthy community outreach before installation is scheduled.  



> Users

SMO POC's and outside agencies to manage the application(s). 

> Sponsorship

Smart Mobility Office 

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

['Transportation cost']

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

['Placemaking — Build a transportation network that encourages social interaction through quality urban design, and connects users to the many places that make Austin unique.']

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

It appears that there are a few more platforms that support things like mobile devices can upload information on the spot, or an external intuitive platform may make it simpler for outside users. 

> Is there anything else we should know?

It would be best to discuss further on Monday, Wednesday, and/or Friday's if availble. 

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

In other cities and departments within COA, standardized platforms are modified to address more specific program needs. 



> Requested By
Luke U.

title: Meeting Notes: Building GIS team workflows
body:
## Editing/QA workflow

Once our team includes technicians, we'll need a system for assigning, performing, and checking edits. The workflow currently in place for VZ Polygon Maintenance provides a good template:

### Github
-  Polygons that need maintenance are assigned individual issues in github by project managers and are placed in backlog
-  Editors move issues to On Deck and In Progress to queue up and work on the edits requested
- Once finished, editors move issues to Review QA, where an analyst can verify the work

### Edit/QA
- Edits happen in Pro on MAINT data
- Data edits are published from MAINT to AGOL
- AGOL data will serve as our authoritative dataset, used across the city, and available for download by the public when applicable
- The AGOL version of each dataset will serve as reference data to check against during the edit/QA process

## Going beyond

While this workflow works well with VZ because the issues are created on a per-polygon basis, it needs to be enhanced to fit the needs of other datasets that have different editing cadences and general structure. For example, Signs data relies on work orders that are filled in Knack.  CTN edits follow a regular cadence, but no work orders or requests take place. We find that github issues provide a useful, simplified structure that allows us to define the scope of an edit (editing a certain polygon, updating certain attributes, etc), and to perform QA checks. However, to bring all the different types of edits we perform into this structure, and to account for all workflows, whether they rely on requests, work orders, or are self-driven, we need a few more elements that may need some testing.

### Issue - feature service connection

Github is a great platform for assigning work. It is simple enough to use, and issues can carry all the information needed in order to perform an edit. However, we currently don't have a consistent way to geographically reference the area, features, or attributes that need to be edited. In the case of Vision Zero Polygons, we receive issues that reference polygon IDs and issues that only name the streets at the intersection requested. In the case of Signs, work orders have a point location. A common editing task in the CTN is bringing in new streets from the CTM street_segment feature, which may or may not be in the same area.

A common geographic identifier to define the scope of the work would compliment to the issue structure of github. We need to create and test a feature service (and web app) that allows the user (project manager, analyst, stakeholder) to draw the extent area, or drop a point in the location that corresponds to a github issue. This feature would include the following fields:

- `GITHUB_ISSUE_ID`
- `GITHUB_PIPELINE`
- `GITHUB_LABEL`

This would allow the editor to pull the feature service on their Pro map and reference data from github. 

At the moment the issue in github is created, the feature is drawn on a web app, and the issue ID is typed in. We'd like to test if this can be used as a relate field, to fill the remaining fields and make them visible on the map. If a relate is not possible, the `GITHUB_ISSUE_ID` field could be used to simply hyperlink to the issue itself. Creating this issue reference geometry would allow us to assign work consistently within github, regardless of data type and issue source. 

### Template with embedded web map app

Creating this reference geometry needs to be as seamlessly integrated into our current github issue creating workflow as possible so that project managers, analysts and stakeholders are not over-burdened by this step. We'd like to test embedding a web map app into an issue template for epics:

#### Template Issue title

1. Create a checkbox list of the features that you'd like to edit and submit the issue. Include necessary data, like IDs into each checkbox item
2. Turn the checkbox tasks into issues 
3. Use the embedded web app to draw a feature for each item on the list and fill in the `GITHUB_ISSUE_ID` field

- [ ] #10168
- [ ] edit polygon b

#### Embedded Web App
![image.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5cb4c4bb73d7e234297de5da/9c0dc5ea-71bf-4e24-b7f1-612ce3fc84f9)


### Label for followup work near closed issues

While github issues help us define the scope of an edit, invariably there will always be more work that needs to happen. Sometimes we come across data that should be fixed, but since it is not the root cause of the issue we're working on, we leave it alone. It doesn't sit well with anyone to leave work on the table, but it can also leave issues open for longer than they need to. In order to track areas that editors see need work, but aren't related to the root cause of the issue, we'd like to create a `geo: revisit` label that we can apply to closed issues. We can then query for this label, and create new issues for the adjacent data that needs editing. This would be most helpful for datasets that don't have a consistent stream of data dumps (like the CTN) or work orders (like signs)
labels: Type: Meeting, Workgroup: DTS

Use of SharePoint to create a repository for policies and procedures, schedule,  deadlines, milestones, etc.  Ability to have multiple users from across the department to access and edit documentation , etc.

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

Collaboration with department users

> Users

Department staff

> Sponsorship

<!--Peggy MacCallum-->Peggy M.

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

['System efficiency and congestion']

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

['Sustainability — Promote integrated designs and quality additions to the built environment while reducing impacts and promoting efficient use of public resources.']

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

Single site to gather required documentation.  Workflow for simple review and approve at multiple levels.  Interactive schedule to keep moving forward.

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

Workarounds would include use of multiple folders on the network drive, attachments in emails.

> Is there anything else we should know?

It would be great if we could have the site available early in September so we can define work processes and document directions for users.

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

PWD has a similar site.  https://cityofaustin.sharepoint.com/sites/PW/PWOPM/APWA/SitePages/Home.aspx?OR=Teams-HL&CT=1661442810746&clickparams=eyJBcHBOYW1lIjoiVGVhbXMtRGVza3RvcCIsIkFwcFZlcnNpb24iOiIyNy8yMjA3MzEwMTAwNSIsIkhhc0ZlZGVyYXRlZFVzZXIiOmZhbHNlfQ%3D%3D

title: Improve TKs process for Finance team
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- dan.valbracht@austintexas.gov -->

> Name

Dan V.<!-- Dan Valbracht -->

> What application are you using?

Other / Not Sure

> Describe the problem.

TKs are currently being tracked in an excel workbook that resides on the shared drive.  the workbook lacks real time information and is difficult to access and requires significant upkeep.  This process makes TK information inaccessible to the majority of staff.  TKs are very specific numbers and PMs and employees who use them on time sheets should have a resource where they can validate the TK number they need to use.  Additionally, time keepers need to be able to look up and validate TKs being used on staff time sheets.  PMs also need to be able to track balances and manage the TKs for their capital projects. 

> Describe the solution you have in mind.

Currently TKs are being tracked through an excel based solution saved on the shared drive (G:).  Finance is seeking a web-based solution where TKs can be tracked by TK number and name, show real-time balances, the responsible PM name, division name, and last use (if possible).  This would need to be able to have updated data from a source such as mstr or AIMs that could show the updated balance if modifications are made as well as use.

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

Success would look like a web-based solution that allowed users to search for and see all TKs used by ATD, the name, number, balance, responsible PM or manager, division name, last use. It would also be beneficial to be able to drill down into charges against a particular TK but not a must as eCAPRIS does provide that information if needed.

> Users

ATD Finance, Project managers (PMs), timekeepers, DMs

> Sponsorship

Anthony S.<!--Anthony Segura-->

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

['None']

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

['None']

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

We have a weekly email that goes out to PMs to avoid negative balances and use excel to track all TKs

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

Currently all solutions are based in excel to my knowledge.  We regularly have TKs that cause payroll errors due to balances going negative.  We also have TKs used that have been closed on timesheets causing payroll rejects.

> Requested By
Dan V.

Request ID: DTS22-105010

title: [Enhancement] Add Components to Lookups view
body:
Add a view of Components to the [lookups view](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/main/moped-editor/src/views/dev/LookupsView/index.js).

Components (`moped_components`) should be filtered for active components only (`status_id` = 1).

#### Columns
| column name | label | value handler
|-|-|-
| Component name | `component_name` |
| Component subtype | `component_subtype` |
| Geometry type | `line_representation `| If `line_representation ` is `true` then "Line" else "Point"
| Subcomponents | `moped_subcomponents.subcomponent_name` | Group related subcomponents into one column (see how we [handle subphases](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/23be103f1f7fc237d03835305e3ec81a19e045c3/moped-editor/src/views/dev/LookupsView/settings.js#L6))

title: Bus Stop Scoring Tool
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- caitlin.d'alton@austintexas.gov -->

> Name

2022 Bus Stop Analysis and Map

> What application are you using?

Other / Not Sure

> Describe the problem.

ATD has an existing tool (https://capmetro.atxvisionzero.xyz/) that we (ATD and CapMetro) use to identify bus stops that should be evaluated for improvement, relocation or closure in order to improve bus operations and safety (what we call “bus stop optimization”). Bus stops are assigned a score based on a variety of metrics (ridership, distance from a safe crossing, etc.), and that score is used to help us prioritize stops to focus limited resources on for improvement. The tool has not been updated over the last 1+ year to include recent data, and it does not include equity as a metric for scoring bus stops. Not having an up-to-date tool that includes equity as a metric makes it a challenge to identify stops for further project development.

> Describe the solution you have in mind.

Updating the existing "CapMetro Stop Scores" tool (https://capmetro.atxvisionzero.xyz/) with recent data, and adding equity as a measure in that tool.

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

We have an updated tool that can be used to identify bus stops for improvement, relocation or closure, and we are able to integrate that updated tool into our 2020 bond planning work that's currently being supported by a consultant team.

> Users

ATD and Capital Metro staff

> Sponsorship

Transit Enhancement Program - Eric Bollich, Anna Martin

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

['System efficiency and congestion', 'Accessibility to and equity of multi-modal transportation choices', 'Safety']

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

['Commuter Delay – Reduce the amount of time workers spend traveling between home and work.', 'Travel Choice — Promote a balanced transportation network and the ability to make informed choices based on personal needs and preferences.', 'Health & Safety — Protect Austinites by lowering the risk of travel-related injury and promoting public health.', 'Affordability — Lower the cost of traveling in Austin by providing affordable travel options.', 'Sustainability — Promote integrated designs and quality additions to the built environment while reducing impacts and promoting efficient use of public resources.', 'Placemaking — Build a transportation network that encourages social interaction through quality urban design, and connects users to the many places that make Austin unique.', 'Economic Prosperity — Promote economic growth for individuals and the city through strategic investments in transportation networks that meet the needs of the 21st century.', 'Innovation — Draw inspiration from forward-looking cities around the world, change the way we think about what’s possible, and set an example for the rest of the country.']

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

If this tool cannot be updated in the short term (by September 16), I will work with a consultant team to determine how they can make an update by that September deadline.

> Is there anything else we should know?

I’d ideally like it to be completed by September 16th (4 weeks). If that’s not possible, it would be helpful to know what is possible within that timeframe. Besides just needing to use this tool to inform ongoing bus stop optimization work, we’d like to pull the data from the tool into a separate bus delay analysis tool (BDAT) that is in development for ATD by a consultant team. This BDAT tool is being used to help us identify and prioritize larger corridors for bond-funded transit improvement projects. The next step in that corridor identification and prioritization process starts 9/19, and if we can’t get the bus stop tool back up and running by then, or can get it up and running but can’t complete the requested updates, I’ll need to come up with a plan B for including that bus stop information into the BDAT.

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

I am not sure.

> Requested By
Caitlin D.

Request ID: DTS22-105005
labels: Workgroup: TED, Type: New Application, Impact: 2-Major, Service: Dev, Service: Product, Need: 2-Should Have

AMANDA

Hello,

I am unable to complete tasks/attempts in AMANDA for approving/rejecting License Agreements etc. I should have the same user permission as Ravi Dhamrat, who upon clicking a license agreement is given a popup to fulfill the task, which I am not given. - Users must search and navigate every time they want to view or work on the same page
- Increased time in app, especially larger apps

**Context:**
Object 27, Field 862
