title: [Traffic Register] Enhancement: Auto Populate Drafted Reg Doc ID
body:
**Desired Outcome:** Simplify the drafting process by auto-populating the Drafted Reg Doc ID to assist with self-connection and connection to all regulations rather than user having to search and set it themselves.

**Problems:**
- User input means a user can enter/select the incorrect ID and mess up the connections
- Increased Drafting time

**Context:**
- **Retire Page:** `Scene 449`, `View 890`, `Field 561` - Self Connection for Approveds set to `Field 936` - Regulation Document ID
- **Retire & Replace Page:** `Scene 450`, `View 892`, `Field 561` - Self Connection for Approveds set to `Field 936` - Regulation Document ID 
- **Save Draft Page:** `Scene 454`, `View 902`, `Field 560` - Self Connection for Drafts set to `Field 936` - Regulation Document ID
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/67915167/185707285-2a6e7aa9-ec88-424f-9d98-af361ba11b21.png)

Similar to Issue #9052
labels: Workgroup: OOD, Workgroup: TED, Service: Dev, Service: Apps, Need: 2-Should Have, Type: Enhancement, Project: Traffic Register 2.0, Product: Traffic Register

title: [BUG] Error on Return Unit Cost - WRK22-148480
body:
[WRK22-148480](https://atd.knack.com/amd#inventory-items/inventory-item-details/5dfa6ac52057600ac95e7932/work-order-details/629bc22a047782001e601686)

# Background
- There was a work order that had a request from Working Stock for `3` - `12 inch Tunnel Visor w/Universal Clips` 
- There was some back and forth on if it should be on Warehouse Inventory

## Transaction Information
- 16532 - was checked out 3 items - `12 inch Tunnel Visor w/Universal Clips` (Working Stock)
- 16684 - was replenished - from warehouse to working stock
- 17461 - was the return on the 3 items - `12 inch Tunnel Visor w/Universal Clips` 
  - this was pulling the Unit Cost from (Working Stock) in 16532

Ronnie said that was inaccurate and should be - `$26.7235`, it was showing up as `$26.000`
- I ended up removing the link between 16532 and 17461
- I tried to override the Unit Cost (Final) with Ronnie - it worked, we changed it to `$26.7235`
- I reset the connection between 16532 and 17461
labels: Workgroup: AMD, Type: Bug Report, Service: Apps, Product: AMD Data Tracker

title: Update phases and subphases for PDD
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- meredith.quick@austintexas.gov -->

> What application are you using?

Moped

> Describe the problem.

We'd like to make some modifications to the list of Phases and Subphases in MOPED.

We'd like to add a Phase called Project Development, where the project schematic is produced.

To the Phase Preliminary Engineering, we'd like to add the Subphase `PER`.
To the Phase Pre-Construction, we'd like to add "bid preparation" to the description, and add the Subphase `Bid Preparation`.
To the Phase Post-Construction, we'd like to add the Subphase `Substantially Complete`.

We'd like to change the name of the Phase Complete to `Close-Out` (or maybe `Close-Out/Complete`.)

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

NA

NA

title: [Feature] Project Tags
body: As a Moped user, I want to tag projects with keywords, phrases, etc. that will help with filtering and identifying sets of projects, surface related projects, enable [unfunded needs matching](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/#3678)... ### In scope - Ability to add a tag to a project from the project summary page - Ability to view a project's tags in a table on the project summary page - Ability to remove a tag from a project - Ability to search for projects by one or more tags ### Out of scope - Ability to create new tags - Ability to edit tag names ### Database changes #### New table - `moped_tags` Lookup table for all tags. | column name | column type | constraints |-|-|- | `id` | `serial` | | `name` | `text` | `unique` | `type` | `text` | | `slug` | `text` | `unique` | `is_deleted` | `bool default false`| #### New table - `moped_proj_tags` Ttores tag/project relationships. | column name | column type | constraints |-|-|- |`id` |`serial`| | `project_id` | `int` | FK to `moped_project` | `tag_id` | `int` | FK to `moped_tags` | `is_deleted` | `bool default false` #### Initial seed of `moped_tags` | `name` | `type` | `slug` | |-|-|-| | MAP Signals 2023 | Work Plan | map_signals2023 | | MAP Transit Enhancement 2023 | Work Plan | map_transitenhancement2023 | | MAP Vision Zero Systemic Safety Curves 2023 | Work Plan | map_vzero_systemicsafety_curves2023 | | MAP Vision Zero Intersections Potential 2023 | Work Plan | map_vzero_intersectionspotential2023 | | MAP Vision Zero Intersections 2023 | Work Plan | map_vzero_intersections2023 | | MAP Vision Zero Speed Management 2023 | Work Plan | map_vzero_speedmanagement2023 | | MAP TIA Fiscal | Work Plan | map_tiafiscal | ### Background research - [IMPDB terms-to-be-mapped](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1VGO57EL1TtASbLz2yeWyLwcTB1lT9LR8G6_QZ4WSifs/edit#gid=0) - [Notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xMTBL-uyNH9keUydl7K29liZdIIHBMdiYTJuqaylTpE/edit#heading=h.p56sm2k8jopf) ### Related features - https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/1962 - https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/3678

labels: Type: Meeting, Workgroup: DTS, Type: Operations

title: Data & Technology Services Fellowship
body:
The Data & Technology Services (DTS) Fellowship is designed to give current graduate students, recents undergraduate degree recipients, or bootcamp graduates in Software Engineering, UX/UI Design, Data Science, GIS, Product Management or related fields the opportunity to establish a solid foundation for a future career in government technology. 

The intent of the fellowship is to magnify the government technology profession, create a pipeline for technologists who are interested in a future in local government, and complement the growth of the DTS team. 

Fellows will work in partnership with the Data & Technology Services team and other divisions in the Transportation Department. They will receive mentorship in area-specific positions and work on current projects with the DTS team. 

The Fellowship is a 4-month to a 1-year commitment. During the last month of the Fellowship it is understood that the Fellow will pursue outside career opportunities and the DTS team will support the Fellow in this search. 

![DTS Fellowship Timeline.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5d68810b05d7792664be403f/37641e5f-7540-4170-8dee-780842f613cd) 

:page_with_curl: [Fellowship Doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1ucljVKebORVqBPOwpVOoHYTIFigW_2kNZqPPKb2Qbtw/edit#heading=h.lpg4vidjddsn)

title: Extend `test` system to allow building DB from seed data
body:
I've become aware that if you want to have your database populated with staging or production data, you must have all the commits which are in `main` or `production respectively in your branch when you deploy the `test` instance. Otherwise, if there have been commits which change the schema in main, upstream of your work, your database migration and metadata application are unable to complete. 

To give people an option away from having to stay up-to-date with main, which isn't a bad thing in its own right but can complicate review in certain cases, is to enable the DB to be populated with seed data. 

- [x] Add seed data option to flow parameters as DB source

title: Work with ESB to stop sending "Closed (Duplicate)" activities
body:
Bill @ 311 has flagged an issue with our handling of duplicate SRs in Knack.

When our staff identify an SR as a duplicate, we send a "Closed (Duplicate)" activity to the ESB, which causes the SR in CSR to be closed with a "Closed - Duplicate" status. According to Bill, this status breaks CSR de-duping engine, and CSR will continue to push more duplicate SRs back to Knack. 

We agreed that we should update the ESB mapping so that a "Closed (Duplicate)" in our system closes the SR in CSR with a "Closed" status (not, "Closed Duplicate").
labels: Workgroup: AMD, Service: Dev, Type: Integration

title: [Tech Debt] Normalize user table workgroup columns (`workgroup` and `workgroup_id`)
body:
In the `moped_users` table, we store both the workgroup name as `workgroup` and the `workgroup_id`. This can be improved by creating a relationship between the `moped_users` table `workgroup_id` and the `moped_workgroup` table which stores the workgroup names.

There are some pieces of code that need to be updated as a result:
- Moped API `/users/` route which expects `workgroup` in the payload and [validates it](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/7cf1cf43605fa1be1b4b58ff43ec02572951c786/moped-api/users/validation.py#L58-L74)
- Moped Editor code for the form which has fields for both `workgroup` and `workgroup_id` and [fetches workgroups from the workgroup table](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/7cf1cf43605fa1be1b4b58ff43ec02572951c786/moped-editor/src/views/staff/StaffForm.js#L189-L193)
labels: Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Product: Moped, Type: Tech Debt

title: [Bug] Fix edge case where user data from the database table doesn't write to local storage
body:
There is an edge case bug in the user auth frontend code where sign in creates an endless loop because `atd_moped_user_db_data` in local storage never writes. As a workaround, you can just copy the values from this entry staging local storage.

_Moped test instances are currently still in development so it will be more straightforward to fix this after we have a GitHub action to spin up test instances_

To reproduce:
1. Try to log into a fresh test with your staging username and password
2. You might get an endless loop where the Project Summary table never loads
3. If you take the value of `atd_moped_user_db_data` from the staging URL local storage and paste it into the `atd_moped_user_db_data` entry of the test instance, you will see the loop stop and the site will load
labels: Type: Bug Report, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Product: Moped, Type: Tech Debt, Type: Snackoo 🍫

title: Update Netlify Deployments which use Xenial prior to November 15, 2022
body:
Netlify has announced that it is going to deprecate the use of the Xenial base ubuntu image for deployments on November 15, 2022. At this point, any builds which depend on it will fail. This will prevent rolling out updates and development builds. 

This is an overdue and reasonable move on their part, Xenial was released 8 years ago in 2016 and has already hit its LTS EOL.

As it stands, this will affect:

* Moped
* Vision Zero
* data.mobiliy.austin.gov
* austinmobilty.io 
* knack-explorer
* _many more_

**_Every_** site we host on Netlify appears to be affected by this announcement.

Each site will need to have its build settings adjusted to use Focal (or Jammy if it's available) & tested. Individually, each site should be a fairly straight forward change, but there will be some tinkering for our more complex builds - moped & vz come to mind.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 1-Severe, Service: Dev, Service: Apps, Service: Product, Need: 1-Must Have, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps, Product: Vision Zero Crash Data System, Product: Vision Zero Viewer, Type: Tech Debt, Type: Integration, Product: Data and Technology Services Portal, Product: DTS Website, Type: Security, Product: ATD Knack Services

title: Author GitHub Workflow Integrations for Moped Test Deployment System
body:
This work is blocked by #9996.

The new test deployment system is created as a Prefect Flow. This flow needs to be invoked by a GitHub action, so that we can use our existing pattern of deploying test instances from the same UI (GitHub) with a similar UX (Actions / Workflows). 

This ticket is to track the creation of that flow, including getting feedback from the dev & product teams. It will also include some brief documentation (see #9998) about how to use the deployment system as well.

I envision the results of a flow invocation will be returned to GitHub when complete, providing the user with the URL to visit for the deployment, and ideally, a deep link into Prefect so the user can investigate the deployment execution in detail (see #9999.)
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Need: 1-Must Have, Type: Documentation, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps, Type: Integration

title: Enhance logging of test deployments utilizing the Prefect artifact system
body:
As it stands, the deployment flows render many thousands of lines of output as they invoke the numerous steps involved in rolling out a test deployment. Much of this is the accumulated `STDOUT` streams from programs which are invoked as a subprocess. 

Prefect offers an Artifact system, which I believe can be used to distill and convey the important milestones in a deployment to the user of the cloud UI. These should include listings of dynamic values such as endpoint URLs and the certain environment variables which are generated uniquely for each deployment. 

Additionally, this ticket should include a brief bit of research on what logging, event result searching, and other systems available to us via the prefect cloud service. How this issue is tackled should be shaped by this new learning.

This will make the tool tremendously more useful and a million times easier to debug.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Type: Documentation, Product: Moped, Type: Integration

title: Document test deployment system
body:
Not a lot to write about this -- just joking! -- but, in all seriousness, we owe this project a detailed write-up on:

* How it works
* Where things are
* Permissions, IAM roles, keys
* Secret handling more broadly
* Prefect integration
* Update process
* Github integration
* Logging
* Excalidraw images and `json` blobs added to the repo

I am envisioning a fresh gitbook page in the Moped project to house this.

Everyone, please feel free to thread any ideas you have about what you'd like to see in these docs. It's hard to see the forest for the trees when you've been looking at it for a while, so all input is welcome!
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 4-None, Service: Dev, Need: 1-Must Have, Type: Documentation, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps

title: Refactor slugging function in test deployment & document naming requirements
body:
The test subsystems all interact with different services on AWS, each with their own unique requirements on naming. Conversely, it's the wild-west in terms of our branches' naming schemes. They often include numbers, sometimes leading numbers, sometimes dashes, sometimes underscores -- all of which break the AWS deployment in different ways.

I wrote some some [ugly hackery here](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/md_moped_test_create_flow/moped-etl/prefect/moped_test_create_flow.py#L292-L304), and this needs to be cleaned up to take a branch name (or PR number, as a bonus feature) and have it kick back an object full of names ready to hand into subsequent tasks.

The findings of the naming requirements research would be helpful to add to documentation.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Need: 3-Could Have, Type: Enhancement, Product: Moped

title: Integrate test system flows into a single commission & decommission flow / document flow
body:
Integration of the test subsystems has been done in the `__main__()` function of the flow file. The flows which are called need to have their contents merged in a meaningful way and the directed acyclic graph carefully reviewed both in terms of each task's prerequisites being met, but also in terms of potential parallelization opportunities.

* [ ] Make it safe to re-run the commission over a running instance to redeploy.

This ticket should also include refactoring the code for readability and for inclusion of inline comments and documentation.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 2-Major, Service: Dev, Need: 1-Must Have, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps

title: Rework Zappa / λ deployment's naming mechanism
body:
During the recent integration of the test system's various flows, I experienced errors from Zappa when deploying λ functions due to some portion of the deployment having a name which exceed a hard 64 character limit.

Via [this operation](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-moped/blob/md_moped_test_create_flow/moped-etl/prefect/moped_test_create_flow.py#L302-L304), I was able to make this work by truncating the branch / `basename` being submitted into this subsystem, but it's truncated down to a max length of 16 characters which feels just too short to reasonably expect to avoid naming collisions. 

I'd like to end up with as much the branch name in the λ function name as possible - it's the easiest way to tie them together in the AWS console.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Type: Feature, Impact: 3-Minor, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Product: Moped, Type: DevOps

title: Project: RAISE Grant GIS Support
body:
This project tracks all DTS GIS Support for the RAISE Grant Application

## Background

This grant will provide necessary funds for an important ATD Project.

## Scope & Deliverables

DTS GIS will provide geographic analysis in support of the grant application.


<!-- + Image  (No Header) (No Header) + -->
https://atd-dts.gitbook.io/wiki/product-ops/dts-website#images

title: Feature (RW-Valet Annual): Update folder status with renewal (Ready for PROD Deployment)
body:
Acceptance Criteria (Permit Renewal)

The following steps were performed in RW-Valet Parking Annual Folder for Renewal
-- A bill was created for fees to be paid
-- The fees in the folder were paid (through portal or Back Office)
-- In the Annual Valet Permitting Process, Process info fields were updated with new Issue date and new Expiry Date
-- Attempt 'Update issue and expiry dates' was made in the annual valet permitting process, along with attempt comments.

Expected result: Folder should update folder status from 'Expired' to 'Active', and also update issue and expiry dates based on process info.

Actual result: Folder updated issue and expiry dates, but did not update folder status to 'Active'
labels: Workgroup: ROW, Need: 2-Should Have, Type: Enhancement, Product: AMANDA

title: Create TDS Fees (Ready for PROD)
body:
TDS Fee Spreadsheet is [here](https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/17Wso9esPgv1deUspTYz-v_VyzZxDeL_10uGaXe_8YYg/edit?usp=sharing)

**Acceptance Criteria**
The fees provided below need to be configured/updated as specified:

**DAC Fees (Residential/Sidewalk Waivers) Review**
- Fee code: New Fee that needs to be configured
- Fee Description: ATD Residential Sidewalk Waiver Review 
- Fee Amount: $35
- Fee Insertion Trigger: 
-- Fee should be inserted when user manually clicks on Add -> Insert and Run Procedure in Fee Tab for PR folders. Fee does not need to be inserted in any other scenario.
-- If there are validations in PR folders to stop users from proceeding due to unpaid fees, these fees do not need to be a part of that validation. (TBD)
-- UAT: We need DSD to help / UAT  👆🏼

**Site Plan Corrections**
- Fee Code: New Fee that needs to be configured
- Fee Description: ATD - Site Plan Correction Review
- Fee amount: $75
- Fee Insertion Trigger: 
-- Fees need to be inserted when Accepted attempt is made in Correction Intake Process in SC Folder. 
-- DSD SPOC: Victor Auzenne

**Transportation Completeness Check**
- Fee Code: New Fee that needs to be configured
- Fee Description: ATD - Transportation Completeness Check
- Fee amount: $25
- Fee Insertion Trigger: 
-- Fees should be inserted when 'Calculate fees' attempt is made on 'Initial Intake' process (51110) in C8, C and SP Folders

**PDA Amendment** 
- Fee Code: New Fee that needs to be configured
- Fee Description: ATD - Planned Development Agreement
- Fee amount: $2810
- Fee Insertion Trigger: 
-- Fees should be inserted when 'Calculate fees' attempt is made on 'Submittal Intake' process (51120) in ZC Folders. 
-- PAZ SPOC is Victor Cortez

**ATD Tech Surcharge**
- Fee Description: ATD Tech Surcharge TDS
- Fee Amount: 4% of any of the above fees inserted in the folder. 
- Fee Insertion Trigger: Fees should be inserted when any of the fees mentioned above are inserted in the folder.
labels: Type: Enhancement, Workgroup: TDS, Product: AMANDA, Provider: LaunchIT, Project: FY22 AMANDA Fee Updates

title: [ROW] Data: Cost-of-Service (COS) JV Update for Aug 2022
body:
- [x] Spreadsheets emailed from Finance
- [x] AE Number of records to update:  307
- [x] ATD Number of records to update: 14
- [x] AW Number of records to update: 236
- [x] CPO Number of records to update: 64
- [x] PWD Number of records to update: 224
- [x] WS Number of records to update: 12
- [x] Total Number of records being updated: 857
- [x] Remove non-JV filtered tabs from spreadsheets and remove any rows without `Journal Voucher ID` if necessary
- [x] Save all 6 spreadsheets as csv. It also helps to save an All Data Excel file if you have to check for data inaccuracies after importing.
- [x] Import (Update) records, match on `Fee Number` & import `Journal Voucher ID`. Set `Import Date` to today [(Review Instructions)](https://atd-dts.gitbook.io/atd-knack-operations/row-portal/cos-jv-update)
- [x] Make sure the number of records being updated matches for all spreadsheets
- [x] Filter records by `Import Date` and make sure the total number of records updated matches
- [x] If inaccurate, check backend filter to see if any of the unmatched records are archived records and marked as `is_archived`. The AMANDA data may be inaccurate, the script may be running incorrectly, or the `Fee Numbers` may be incorrect if the record amount does not match the number of Archived records.
- [x] Also check for duplicate `Fee Numbers` which could be duplicate records or have the wrong fee number. These need to be reconciled with Finance.
- [x] Email Finance (and others cc'd) that the update task is complete
labels: Workgroup: Finance, Workgroup: ROW, Type: Data, Service: Apps, Product: ROW Portal

title: Schema based, layered data in postgres
body: Frank will seek to explore a multi-schema, data-layering construct in postgres with the aim of storing data from disparate sources and exposing it as if it were "overlaid." The intent is to simplify CRIS data imports by cleaving it away from VZ stakeholder edits. Temporal database change tracking may be incorporated as time permits.
labels: Type: Research

title: Typescript
body:
Learn about the pro and cons of Typescript.

## What is Typescript?
- Microsoft's strongly typed language based on Javascript.
- It is a superset of Javascript, which means you can use normal Javascript and incrementally add TS features to your code as you learn.
- Open sourced in 2012.
- In the 2021 State of JS survey (released Feb '21), when asked about their use of “JavaScript flavors," 69% of survey respondents now use TypeScript, compared to just 21% six years ago. 
- Current version is 4.7
labels: Service: Dev

title: Backend PostGIS updates for all geometry fields
body:
We currently store components' spatial data in a `jsonb` column in the `moped_proj_features` [table](https://db-docs.austinmobility.io/atd-moped-staging/tables/moped_proj_features.html).

We should use native PostGIS `geometry` columns to store spatial data. This will allow us to perform spatial queries and other operations against our component data. 

See scoping effort [here](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/9741).

## Goal
*  Begin to store geometry natively in our database
*  Gain access to all the GIS functions provided by PostGIS
*  Gain access to GIS functions provided by `graphql-engine`
*  Gain access to geographically aware indexing
*  Ease future integrations with ESRI's GIS suite

## Task Process
### Identify geographic data stored as GeoJSON or pairs of `float` fields
* Create a list of each column or pairs of columns which stores GeoJSON or some other geographic data
* Record if each represents a `Point`, `LineString`, or `Polygon` type geometry, or a more complex combination
* Record if each record's data encodes a single geometry or a collection of geometries
* Record at least that the projection is well defined or determine what is being used if not for each column
* Record and assess any properties or attributes encoded in GeoJSON and how that will be retained.
### Create new columns for data
#### Geometry columns
* The columns should be named in a non-generic way and avoid keywords. (`geom`, `geometry`, etc 👎🏻)
* The columns should be typed as specifically as possible. 
  * If certain geometries come in a variety of dimensions, careful consideration should be taken to either remediate them into a uniform dimension or utilize multiple columns, one for points and one for lines, etc.
* The columns should all have a defined SRID and the group should come to consensus on what SRID that should be. 
  * I suggest 2277: [NAD83 / Texas Central (ftUS)](https://epsg.io/2277).
 #### Ancillary columns for storing properties and attribute data
* The typing and schema of the new columns depends on the data found, but generally these choices are driven by the data found
### Populate the geometry columns
* For records with well formed GeoJSON, this may be accomplished with an `UPDATE` statement.
* For those with more complex situations, a python script may be required.
### Deprecate storage mechanism for GeoJSON data
* Delete the columns which contain the GeoJSON
* Update the Moped Application / graphql mutations to use the new columns
  * PostGIS offers functions to generate native geometry from GeoJSON and ability to produce GeoJSON from native geometries, so this hopefully is a manageable, but certainly non-trivial, task. 
  * This is the lion share of this task's work.
* Views can be used to expose the native geometry in a format that is more readily accepted by the application as well.

## Acceptance Criteria
* All geometries are stored using native PostGIS geometry
* No GeoJSON or GeoJSON-like blobs are used in the Moped Database
* App passes all related tests from the testing script
* `moped_proj_features.feature.properties` attributes are accounted for
labels: Service: Dev, Need: 1-Must Have, Type: Enhancement, Product: Moped, Type: Tech Debt

title: Prefect 2.0 dockerized-agent configuration
body:
This ticket is meant to track the work of creating a Prefect 2.0 dockerized-agent configuration in the `atd-prefect` repo.

With Prefect's recent 2.0 release, we should investigate the best route forward to handle this upgrade in our own flows and deployment systems. The release is still very fresh, so we should give this a little time to settle down and let those .0 release bugs get worked out. 

One method discussed to aid in the testing and updating of our flows is to create a new dockerized-agent configuration which installs the latest prefect libraries, in effect, creating a test environment to work with the new API.
labels: Workgroup: DTS, Impact: 4-None, Service: Dev, Need: 2-Should Have, Type: DevOps, Product: DTS Service Delivery, Type: Snackoo 🍫

User can choose to save the updated text by selecting the blue check mark button, or exit editing by clicking on the red X button.

- id: Int
- date: timestamp
- created_by: user_id/Int (foreign key) (Q: do we have user data in Moped DB or is that all outsourced to Auth0?)
- text: string
- created_at: timestamp
- updated_at: timestamp
- crash_id: Int (foreign key)

- [x] Using the Hasura Console, create a new table with the columns above.
https://vzd-staging.austinmobility.io/data/schema/public/table/add
- [x] Make sure to update the table [Permissions](https://vzd-staging.austinmobility.io/console/data/schema/public/tables/notes/permissions) so that editors can read/write & read-only can read.
- [x] As a final step, go ahead and seed the staging database with some records. You can create these in the Hasura console [here](https://vzd-staging.austinmobility.io/console/data/schema/public/tables/notes/insert)

**Reminder: any and all changes made to either the Postgres DB directly or through the Hasura Console will need to be documented and replicated in the production Hasura Console during the next release deployment process.**
labels: Type: Feature, Service: Dev, Need: 1-Must Have, Workgroup: VZ, Product: Vision Zero Crash Data System

title: Change underlying maps in crash pages from Mapbox to Nearmap
body:
Staff would like to update the underlying map on the crash pages from Mapbox to Nearmap to get a more accurate representation of the latest road improvements. 

![Screen Shot 2022-08-02 at 11.25.20 AM.png](https://images.zenhubusercontent.com/5d68810b05d7792664be403f/be12b82a-007b-4631-877f-6dda1c553f53)

There was discussion at the [October 2021 meeting](https://web.microsoftstream.com/video/bf32c7a8-c6ef-4556-82d0-4d3b67f747b9) about making this change, but no action was taken. 

[Notes](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1OAmx8MzjhJjVsGwW9MBrncWaX3JaIxo282uutb7yunw/edit) from the meeting outlined the following:
- Talk about Nearmap API Token, and why we’re using Mapbox token in the Crash maps and Nearmap for Locations map. 
  - Do we want to update the code so that it references one service?
  - Action Steps
    - Let’s see if we can get a Nearmap tile layer with street names
    - Update Locations maps to use Nearmap API
    - Potential to have a way to toggle between street view and aerial map

title: Spike: Vulnerable User Analysis
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- xavier.apostol@austintexas.gov -->

> Name

Xavier Apostol

> What application are you using?

Other / Not Sure

> Describe the problem.

Using https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/8059, I'd like to focus on Vulnerable User Analysis (Pedestrians, eScooters, and Bicyclists) using the VIN of the motor vehicle and the interaction with the vulnerable user.

> Describe the solution you have in mind.

Using the VIN decoder we can see additional data points that could lead to safer outcomes in interactions between motor vehicles and vulnerable users.

> How will we know that our solution is successful?

Identifying characteristics of the roadway, motor vehicle, vulnerable user, or others that could assist us in marketing plans or safety recommendations. 

> Users

Xavier Apostol
Charlie Henry

> Sponsorship

Xavier Apostol

> Which Strategic Direction 2023 “Mobility” indicators would this new application impact?

['Safety']

> Which Austin Strategic Mobility Plan goals would this new application support?

['Health & Safety — Protect Austinites by lowering the risk of travel-related injury and promoting public health.']

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

Currently, there is none, but considered a Read/Replica of the VZdb on the LightSail server.

> Is there anything else we should know?

Open

> How have other divisions/departments/cities addressed similar challenges? 

N/A

> Requested By
Xavier A.

title: Project: ROW Performance Volume Tracking Dashboard
body:
We are compiling multiple sets of data related to Right-of-Way performance and creating a PowerBi dashboard to display the data to internal users. 

## Background

The Right-of-Way Management division of ATD uses various software to manage their services. At this time management has no comprehensive way to compile ROW performance data, impacting their ability to make data driven decisions.  

## Scope & Deliverables

We will create a ROW Performance dashboard that incorporates data from:
- AMANDA
- KNACK
- 311

## Desired Outcomes

Internal business partners will have access and tools so they can make data driven decisions. 

<!-- + Image  (No Header) (No Header) + -->


![Screen Shot 2022-07-28 at 4 41 53 PM Cropped](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49930868/181642736-02e94e7c-0fb1-456b-8dde-6a6fc90498b8.png)

title: Pursue internship with ACC GIS students
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- peggy.maccallum@austintexas.gov -->

> What application are you using?

ArcGIS

> Describe the problem.

Request from HR/Equity:  Every semester students here in the GIS department at ACC work on a service-learning project where they volunteer their knowledge, skills, and abilities to complete a set of GIS projects for a local agency or organization.  This is an opportunity for them to gain real-world experience while benefiting the community.

Previously, students have collaborated with TreeFolks, the Southwest Travis County Groundwater Conservation District, the City of Sunset Valley, and more.  As you can see in those links provided, students work on a variety of projects.  

We would love to collaborate with the City of Austin to develop a list of projects that you might be interested in having students complete.  They would begin the projects mid-semester and finish up the projects near the end of the semester - about 8 weeks total.  The time obligation on your end is quite minimal.  We will develop the project statement to work (similar to those links above) after discussing your project ideas with you.  After that, we just ask that you meet with us and the students for a kick-off meeting to get the ball rolling and then again for a showcase meeting where they present their results to you.



> How soon do you need this?

Flexible  — An extended timeline is OK

> Requested By
Peggy M.

title: [Bug] Discrepancy in phase / "Active" status trigger
body:
When the current phase is Bid/Award/Execution, the status says Active.  But for other phases, the status says the phase.

Bug: 
- Your badge gets reset when you add a new phase even if you don't mark it as current.
- Badge shouldn't change unless you switch a phase to "current" or delete the phase that is the "current" phase. Thats when would would use the "Active" fallback.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1463708/181354711-a8d3b0aa-140b-4b91-9653-5724d689a816.png)

title: Publish "stopgap" ASMP  to AGOL
body: Whille the ASMP data will eventually be automatically added from DM to AGOL, we received a service request from SDD and members of the public that, in the meantime, asks us to publish the ASMP data to various public viewers. Once the official data is published by CTM, this stopgap ASMP layer will be removed from AGOL to not create confusion as to which layer is authoritative.
labels: Workgroup: SDD, Service: Geo, Project: GIS Support for the ASMP Amendment

title: Add missing ASMP_NETWORK_IDs
body: In the time between the ASMP adoption in 2019, and the amendment process of 2021-2022, the street network has grown. This growth, along with maintenance edits have resulted in new segments. The new segments need an ASMP_STREET_NETWORK_ID to join to other data and to pass validation in geodatapusher, as it is the primary key for the dataset.
labels: Workgroup: SDD, Service: Geo, Project: GIS Support for the ASMP Amendment

title: Issue bulk work orders for electronic lock task (e lock)
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- ivonne.natal@austintexas.gov -->

> What application are you using?

Data Tracker

> Describe the problem.

AMD is getting ready to roll out citywide Signal Cabinet Security Upgrades.  We need to issue WRKs to all signals so e-locks (inventory) are charged to appropriate location.  Can DTS help to create a batch of WRKs for this purpose.   There will be 2-3 inventory items per signal (per WRK).  

Additionally -- after project is completed we'll need to add serial number information from vendor website to traffic signal assets - cabinet front door, cabinet back door and BBS cabinet

> Describe the outcome you'd like to see when this feature is implemented.

ATD deployment staying on target by not having to create 1100 individual work tickets in data tracker. 

> Describe any workarounds you currently have in place or alternative solutions you've considered.

Besides assigning e-locks to each location (via serial number thru vendor application)  he will have to create one work order per location to charge the lock to inventory.  

> Is there anything else we should know?

Mid August - pilot corridor (25-30 signals)
Mid September - expected deployment of e-locks to 50 signals
October - September - e-locks citywide.

> Requested By
Ivonne N.

title: Allow multiple components per selected/drawn geometry
body:
There is a redundancy of component-geography being 1 to 1. Could it be possible to have component geography with the different component types without recreating a long polyline? 

This was more-or-less the concept depicted on [this slide](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1u-ehecX1noZRsdh8gbmf2VqpTeBf5r4s-mkBgiAM35g/edit#slide=id.gbd2a54ca88_0_1262). But it introduces a completely new set of UI complications vis vis what's currently implemented. 

We might call this "geometry-driven-components", in which we decouple the project extent (its geometry) from the  components which are attached to specific pieces of that extent.
labels: Service: Dev, Product: Moped, Workgroup: PD

title: Gain access to more robust financial code data
body:
As we refine the details of https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/issues/9806, I'm fairly confident about the financial data to which we need expanded access.

Essentially, we need a list of _every_ FDU known to the City, as well as the eCapris subproject ID affiliated with it (if applicable—operating budget FDUs would not have these).

This would allow us to present our users with a list of known FDUs, and similarly we could automatically render the FDUs 
related to a project's subproject.

Ultimately, this data would be incorporated into our finance data [ETL pipeline](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-finance-data), published to Socrata, and consumable in Moped.
labels: Type: Data, Service: Dev, Product: Moped, Workgroup: PD

title: Publish Moped CTN segments to AGOL feature service
body:
In order to accomplish #7012, we need the Moped CTN segments to be published as a publicly-shared feature service on ArcGIS Online. The only attributes that need to be included are the same attributes currently published in the vector tile layer. 

Note that we do not need the intersection points (which are included in the tile layer).
labels: Service: Geo, Product: Moped, Project: Moped v1.0

title: Project: Case Management for TCP Review Mod
body:
We're upgrading the TCP Review module to provide staff and customers with tools to manage intake, review, and approval of traffic control plans. 

## Background

When a traffic control plan is required an applicant must submit a plan to Right of Way Management for review. TCP review is partially managed across three platforms: AMANDA, Outlook, and the ROW Portal. Using Outlook as a case management tool for TCP review can lead to many negative outcomes including decreased customer service, loss of data integrity, double data entry, and missed deadlines. 

We intend to upgrade the current TCP Review mod on the The ROW Portal to provide end-to-end case management features for the entire TCP review workflow (other than those we are required to use AMANDA for). 

## Scope & Deliverables

Features we are considering to achieve end-to-end case management features include:

- A public facing web portal to allow customers to submit plans for intake and resubmittals.  
- Implementation of advanced iterative review management features, as seen in the TIA Mod. 
- Creation of a new workflow to manage completeness check 
- Features to track fee and Cost of Service Data

## Desired Outcomes

1. Customers use a web portal to initiate TCP plan review submittals. 
2. Internal staff no longer have to manually create TCP cases in the ROW Portal.
4. We will be able to map TCP plan data to it’s related data in AMANDA. 
5. Applicants and staff will receive automated emails to assist the workflow. 

## 

<!-- + Image  (No Header) (No Header) + -->
![50115386463_88db8c52ef_h](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49930868/180086790-99616533-3be7-400a-a3b1-825e15eee6a6.jpg)


---

This Github issue represents a project of Austin Transportation's [[Data & Technology Services](https://austinmobility.io/)](https://austinmobility.io/) team. Project status is documented regularly in the comments below.

- Add a new "Project:" label here: [https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/labels](https://github.com/cityofaustin/atd-data-tech/labels). Use the hex code #3D3D3D.
- Add a project evaluation here: [https://atd.knack.com/dts#project-evaluation/](https://atd.knack.com/dts#project-evaluation/)
-->
labels: Workgroup: ROW, Need: 1-Must Have, Product: ROW Portal, Project Index, Project: TCP Review Case Management

title: [Enhancements] Project funding: ability to select fund sources from eCapris subproject
body:
Enable users to add fund sources to their project based on a list of FDUs tied to a subproject ID.

### In scope

- If a subproject ID is populated, give users the option of selecting fund sources from a list of FDUs tied to the subproject in eCapris.

### Out of scope

- Keeping fund source data in "sync" between Moped and eCapris. A project's fund sources in Moped must be manually maintained if a fund source changes in eCapris
- Sowing fund expenditures or balances in Moped

title: Crashes not being flagged correctly as Austin Full Purpose (AFP)
body:
<!-- Email -->
<!-- xavier.apostol@austintexas.gov -->

> What application are you using?

Vision Zero (Editor)

> Describe the problem.

There are crashes that are not being flagged as Austin Full Purpose (AFP) jurisdiction even though the location (position) of the crash is inside of the AFP geometry. 

> Is there anything else we should know?

Here is the query I used to find the 151 crashes that are affected by this:

`select atc.crash_id from atd_txdot_crashes as atc inner join atd_jurisdictions as aj on true and (aj.geometry && atc."position") and ST_Intersects(aj.geometry, atc."position") and aj.id=5 where atc.austin_full_purpose='N'`

> Website Address

https://visionzero.austin.gov/editor/#/crashes

Internet Browser: Edge

> Requested By
Xavier A.

Request ID: DTS22-104710
labels: Type: Bug Report, Impact: 2-Major, Workgroup: VZ, Product: Vision Zero Crash Data System
